title: For Sale/Trade:  ORIGINAL WWII NAZI 7.92MM Armor Piercing Incindiary Tracer Ammunition
location: 1 hour North of Seattle, Seattle, Washington
postcontent:
***ACTUAL PICTURES AVAILABLE TO SERIOUS BUYERS

Original ammunition in the original box embossed with the Nazi war eagle and dated 1937. In perfect mint condition. Looks like it was made yesterday. Pretty good for being 75 years old. This is copper jacketed, hollow steel core armor piercing incindiary, (yellow) tracer ammunition. 15 rounds per box, 1 box available. They are loaded on original 5 round stripper clips for the K98.

By armor piercing incindiary tracer, I mean: a round that can be seen in flight by the shooter, that will penetrate up to two inches of steel armor, and then explode at over 2500 degrees C lighting any flamable materials within five feet on fire. They don't make bullets like this anymore for obvious reasons.

It was intended for fighter aircraft or the MG-34, but it will work in any rifle chambered for the 8MM (7.92mm) Mauser cartridge including the MG-42. You will never get another chance to buy these.

This ammunition was designed to detonate the fuel tank of whatever it was fired at, and a single bullet can take down a B-17 with a well placed shot. These bullets were responsible for many thousands of Allied aircraft losses in WWII.

These are being sold as military collectables and are not intended to be used as ammunition. However, you could if you wanted to. They still work just fine.

Looking to trade for a cheapo .22 revolver, .38 revolver, Mosin Nagant carbine, interesting WWII and WWI collectables, Soviet military stuff, sabres, and the like.

Or make a cash offer. This box of 15 cost over $50 at a gun show in 1987. Only one case of 660 rounds was ever legally imported into the U.S. before the ATF ban.

I accept Paypal, personal chck, cashiers check, and postal money orders and will ship if paid $15 for UPS shipping plus a $20 HazMat fee.

title: For Sale:  *Beautiful & RARE* Pre-1933 COLT 38 Bankers Special 6-Shot Revolver *CLEAN*
postcontent:
***VERY RARE & VERY BEAUTIFUL***

I have decided to sell my COLT 38 Bankers Special, its a .38 caliber 6 Shot Revolver DA/SA that was made and used by bankers from 1926 until 1940. There were 2 styles made, the PRE 1933's and the POST 1933's. PRE 1933's had a square style butt on them and in 1933 they went to an all round butt. This COLT Bankers Special is the PRE 1933, it has the square Butt. 
There were only around 35,000 ever made, most were given to the Bankers of that time due to the Super Snub nose it had. THIS IS A VERY RARE COLT, if you are familiar with GunBroker, there was currently 1, just one, on there for sale and it had 39 bids and ended an hair under $1,900 for just the gun, no box, no papers. Same as this one. Its the only one i have ever seen for sale, I'm sure there are a few more out there but no one wants to part with em. The gun is in great shape, all original, and has original Wooden 2 piece grips on it. It could be taken to the range and shot today if you chose to do so. Its a Great little gun, the design is eye catching and its in amazing shape
 and on top of all that... its a COLT.
REDACTED
Michael

title: For Sale:  P-64 9mm x 18 makarov Polish - Great for CCW
postcontent:
This P-64 is in very nice condition. Number match. Includes holster, 2 magazines and cleaning tool. The blue finish show some light holster wear. The bore is nice and clean. The 9mm makarov ammo is inexpensive.

Has been modified with Wolff springs to reduce recoil, double action pull and mag release force. Recoil and double action pull are the two main complaints about this gun. A stronger recoil spring makes it much more comfortable to shoot. a weaker hammer spring reduces the force required for the double action pull and makes it much easier to release the magazine.

The small size and single stack mag makes this a very nice gun for concealed carry. Fits easily in a pocket and there are various holsters available.

Face to face with Ohio resident over 21 only.

This is a very nice gun and I'm not in a hurry to sell it. The price is pretty firm. Please don't send me your ridiculous low ball offers. Also, I don't need anyone telling me what they think this gun is worth.

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson -- S&W Model 52-2 .38 Spl. Midrange Wadcutter Auto
postcontent:
This is a Smith and Wesson Model 52-2 automatic pistol in .38 Special Midrange Wadcutter. This is a rare pistol with only a few thousand made between 1971 and 1993. The serial number is TAK5055. The front sight is a 1/8" partridge front sight and the rear sight is fully adjustable. The original grips are checkered walnut grips with Smith and Wesson monograms. The gun has a serrated trigger and hammer with adjustable trigger stop. Included with this pistol is 5 magazines and a non-factory box with end tag serial numbered to the gun.

Condition: This pistol is in 95% overall condition. The grips are sharp with no losses or cracks. All markings are deep. The finish is factory original. The only losses to the finish are at the high points and the gun has only the slightest use and storage marks. The action is tight and fully functional. The bore is sharp and mirror.

Overall this is a desirable pistol in a rare caliber that has only the slightest signs of use and age.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Restored-Sporterised arisaka type 38 6.5 mm rifle
postcontent:
This is my grandfathers trophy gun from his WWII south pacific tour in the u.s.m.c. I recently got it back from some relatives of mine who didn't care to much about the true value of the gun.some How the barrel is perfect but the stock was horrible,cracked and etc.....
I had to put a lot of restoration work to the stock suck as wood putty and glue plus I coated it with a durable textured rubber coating that mimics a modern synthetic stock,I tried to just re stain and seal it but i could not hide the repairs unless I painted or covered the stock.I know that the 6.5 mm is popular with the long shooter community and collectors but not hunters and with good reason!this is not a rifle for a novice or beginner,the action is very tricky and you must handle the gun with finess and respect .....I suggest you practice opening and closing the bolt untill you get the hang of it before you load a round and also only use the Japanese 6.5 rounds in the gun.....Mauser or Italian style 6.5 rounds will not chamber entirely correct in thegun and cause problems.
I'm asking a foe able price of 175 local hand to hand or 200 out of state etc.....
But I would prefer trading it for some old ,broken or rusty guns I can restore or trade for a decent pistol or shotgun

Gun has original bluing and the original grips with the Remington logo on them. Gun shoots as it should and is in perfect working order, Cylinder aligns correctly and cylinder lock up tight. These guns were produced for the U.S. Calvary between 1891-1894 and only 2000 were made. Remington made three production runs of this weapon, the first run was produced without serial numbers ( this pistol does not have serial numbers), the second and third runs did have serial numbers. title: For Sale:  P.O. Ackley .219 Wasp High Wall Barrel
postcontent:
I bought this barrel for a High Wall varmint project. However, I am getting married and sadly I need to sell some of my projects. P.O. Ackley custom .219 Wasp barrel for Winchester 1885 High Wall. I am assuming it is for the .219 Donaldson Wasp. However, I never got around to making a chamber casting. Cases are formed from 30-30 Win. The barrel is 24" long, 5/8" at the muzzle & 1 1/8" at breech and weighs in at 5lbs. Rifling is excellent and appears to be four groove button with a right-hand twist. Threads are in very good shape. Bluing is very good with a very deep blue color. It has been drilled and tapped for (per previous owner) Unertl mounts. It is stamped with P.O. Ackley on the top about 1/3 way down. It is also stamped .219 Wasp on the left side of the barrel by the threads. This apparently is one of the two methods for barrel stamping barrels actually made by Ackley. 

This is an excellent varmint barrel, not to mention it is a P.O. Ackley. Here is reference to an article on the .219 Wasp.
www.chuckhawks.com/219_Wasp_Thornblom.htm

Will be shipped via UPS or FedEx with Winner paying shipping. I accept check, credit card and PayPal as payment. For credit card & PayPal payments, 3% will be added to final price. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

title: For Sale:  Swarovski HD STM 65 Scope Body
postcontent:
Swarovski HD STM 65 - Scope Body Magnesium


Swarovski Optik's an Austrian family-owned company steeped in the tradition of producing superlative binoculars and telescopes.  Their products are often icons of both optics and aesthetics, with the posh spotting scopes being hallmarks of the distinguished brand.

The STM-65 HD Spotting Scope is the flagship compact model, featuring an objective element made with extra-low dispersion glass.  This provides an even more remarkable image than the "normal" STM-65, with better edge resolution.  In particular, color fringing is nearly eliminated.  Intricately-patterned subjects will have more crisp delineation, something enthusiastic birders will greatly appreciate, and the more refined color rendition can give an impression of enhanced brightness.  However it is defined, it would be hard to conceive of a better view originating from a prismatic refractor telescope.  And this is a scope which could accompany any tough hike without weighing you down.

The STM-65 HD also has Swarovski's latest external coatings for repelling moisture, dust, and debris.  They stay clean longer, and clean easily.  Furthermore, and perhaps most importantly, the STM/STM series features a fully magnesium housing construction, shaving a few precious drops of weight without giving up an ounce of rigidity.

This is the angled version of Swarovski's 65mm scope-they've also got a straight viewing model.  Generally speaking, angled scopes are better for viewing elevated subjects and are unquestionably easier to share amongst a group of observers.  An angled scope requires a bit of experience to find subjects in the scope, although the STM-65 HD does have a side-mounted peepsight to aid initial locating.

The STM-65 has a focal length of 460mm.  If you're using conventional 1.25" astronomy eyepieces with the optional #44010 Astronomy Eyepiece Adapter, divide 460mm by the focal length of your eyepiece to determine the effective magnification.

 High definition objective glass element with fluoride yields better subject edges and superior digiscoping imagery
 Incredibly-precise tolerances and efficient baffling upon all optical surfaces
 Swarovski's microthin coatings produce optimum light transmission and resolution
 Swarovski's proprietary dirt-and-water-repellent "SWAROCLEAN" external coating
 Light, magnesium construction housing with durable armor
 Large focusing barrel with oversized grooves for fine control
 Retractable rubber lenshood
 Rotating tripod collar with detented click stops
 Operating range from -4 to 131F (-20 to 55C)
 Both 1/4"-20 & 3/8"-16 tripod threads (scope's foot attaches directly to Swarovski tripod heads without using threading)
 Fantastic optional digiscoping adapter, as well as a SLR adapter
 Environmentally friendly lead and arsenic free glass
 Accepts 67mm screw-in filters at objective lens
 Accepts conventional 1.25" astronomy eyepieces with optional #44010 Astronomy Eyepiece Adapter
 Made in Austria

Swarovski STM 65 Spotting Scope


Swarovski Optik produces some of the world's finest optical designs and products. Their brilliant, innovative optical products & designs exemplify their commitment to uncompromising quality.

Swarovski's STM-65, delivers the same legendary high-performance viewing capabilities of its immediate non-HD predecessor, with a poignant twist - its housing is constructed from a lightweight yet extremely durable magnesium alloy.

The STM-65 delivers spectacular imaging performance - its optical system features precision ground and fully multicoated all-glass lenses with SWAROCLEAN coatings to ensure a bright, crisp, and well detailed viewing experience. Highly efficient porro prisms provide both a traditional form factor and outstanding imaging accuracy.

Functionally, the STM-65 is quite an advanced optic - the retractable sun-shade and detented rotating tripod collar offer versatility and resiliency in the face of real-life adversities. With the addition of the UCA camera adapter, a sturdy tripod, and a balance plate, the STM-65 scope converts into a potent ultra-telephoto digiscoping lens.
